Gal Moreira Dini

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/6347878584051301
  • Última atualização do currículo em 06/11/2014

International Associate Editor of PRS. Mestrado em Cirurgia Plástica (2000) e Doutorado (2004) pela Universidade Federal de São Paulo -Escola Paulista de Medicina Atualmente é Professor Orientador de Mestrado e Doutorado em Medicina Tranaslacional (Capes 6) da Universidade Federal de São Paulo. É Chefe do Setor Rinoplastia DCP da UNIFESP-EPM. Professor Afiliado da Universidade Federal de São Paulo. Editorial Board Plastic & Reconstructive Surgery Magazine GO, Revisor/ Plastic & Reconstructive Surgery Magazine, Revista da Sociedade Brasileira de Cirurgia Plástica, Brazilian Journal of Medical and Biological Research, African Journal of Pharmacological Research, Turkiye Klinikleri Journal of Medical Sciences, Rev. Ciências Biológicas e da Saúde da Univ. Norte Paraná.Full Member Brazilian Society PS, Brazilian College of Surgeons, FILACP, IPRAS, ISAPS, PSRC, Rhinoplasty Society, EAFPS and Nose Foundation. International Associate Editor of PRS (Texto informado pelo autor)

The Plastic Surgery Research Council, PSRC, Estados Unidos.
Vínculo institucional

2013 - Atual
Vínculo: Professor orientador, Enquadramento Funcional: PSRC Mentorship Program- PSRC, Carga horária: 4
Outras informações
The PSRC Mentorship Program was developed as a way to enrich the membership experience for Research Council members. The program pairs established plastic surgery researchers with young faculty, fellows, residents, medical students and research fellows to provide them with the unique opportunity to gain experience from seasoned research veterans. The Mentorship Program is a 1-year time commitment for both mentors and mentees. Recommended activities for the 1-year period include meeting at the PSRC Spring 2014 and Fall 2014 Mentorship Program Breakfasts, phone and email exchanges throughout the year, and connecting at affiliated meetings when possible.
